Back in the 19th century, when Bridgeport had its first boom, the man leading the way was PT Barnum, the great circus showman.
He was the beloved mayor of the city, and festivals and museums, and civic landmarks still bear his name.

Having been incorrectly identified as the person who said there's a sucker born every minute.
